data.title: Former UC Basketball Star James White Joins Minnesota Timberwolves Coaching Staff
data.meta_description: Former UC Basketball Star James White Joins Minnesota Timberwolves Coaching Staff
data.text:
CINCINNATI — Former Cincinnati basketball star James "Flight" White is back in the NBA as a player development assistant with the Minnesota Timberwolves.

White had previously been a part of the team's G-League affiliate, the Iowa Wolves.

“We are excited to support Jeff and James in their new roles as they transition from the Iowa Wolves to our coaching staff in Minnesota,” said Timberwolves Head Coach Chris Finch. “As we have since my arrival to the Twin Cities, we have put an emphasis on staff development and rewarding the hard work and dedication those on our staff make to the organization.”

White was a strong player at UC during the early 2000s. He scored 1,088 points in his three years (2003-06) with the Bearcats and was a second-round pick of the Portland Trail Blazers. He played three seasons in the NBA.
